Message.Title: it took Bush 6 days to respond to Katrina
Message.Msg: first he had most of the national guard fighting overseas so he had to do a lot of sexual harassment training before they could be sent in. LOL ue to the slow response to the hurricane, New Orleans's top emergency management official called the effort a "national disgrace" and questioned when reinforcements would actually reach the increasingly desperate city.[9] New Orleans's emergency operations chief Terry Ebbert blamed the inadequate response on the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA). "This is not a FEMA operation. I haven't seen a single FEMA guy", he said. "FEMA has been here three days, yet there is no command and control. We can send massive amounts of aid to tsunami victims, but we can't bail out the city of New Orleans."[9] In the early morning of September 2 mayor Ray Nagin expressed his frustration at what he claimed were insufficient reinforcements provided by the President and federal authorities.[10][11] However, many police, fire and EMS organizations from outside the affected areas were reportedly hindered or otherwise slowed in their efforts to send help and assistance to the area. FEMA sent hundreds of firefighters who had volunteered to help rescue victims to Atlanta for 2 days of training classes on topics including sexual harassment and the history of FEMA.[12]

Message.Title: MRVL-Einhorn's fund just loaded Up.
Message.Msg: Follow the Leader In this article I describe stocks I found interesting from Greenlight Capital's portfolio and explain some facts about each company. Greenlight is the hedge fund that David Einhorn started in 1994 with just $300,000 and now has more than 5 billion in assets under management. David Einhorn is one of the most successful long/short equity hedge fund managers of the past decade. David Einhorn's Greenlight Capital returned 15.9% in 2010, and 21.5% since its inception in 1996. Greenlight Capital's market beta is around 0.5, meaning if they didn't have any stock picking skills, they would have returned about half of the market's return. It is important to evaluate not only each company's fundamentals and the whole "story" but the quality of the management. I analyzed Greenlight's holdings using whalewisdom.com

Topic.Title: not all baggers are racist

Message.Msg: //DP: racism is unacceptable but classism is ok?//(*) "Thereâs class warfare, all right, but itâs my class, the rich class, thatâs making war, and weâre winning." - Warren Buffet Real, inflation-adjusted wages peaked in the early 1970s, and have never recovered, not even during the hiring boom of the late 1990s. Currently they are 15+% below their prior peak. During the same period, per capita worker productivity more than doubled, and real, inflation-adjusted economic output/GDP TRIPLED. That's right, during an era when the real, inflation-adjusted economic pie TRIPLED in size, rank-and-file workers' real, inflation-adjusted wages FELL BY FIFTEEN PERCENT. ALL the value of the U.S. society's increased productivity and output (after adjusting for labor force population growth), has gone - and continues to go - to a tiny sliver at the very top of the wealth/income ladder. PLUS ANOTHER 15%+ OF WORKER WAGES. What's more, every major RepubliCONservative policy espoused or implemented during the same period (to name but a few: decreased tax burdens on capital gains, dividends and other "rich guy" income, increased relative tax burden on ordinary income, cuts in the social safety net, "free" trade policies, offshoring, looting of pensions a la Myth RobbedMe, wars fought to benefit Big Oil, attempts to crush collective bargaining and labor unions generally, etc.), has had this as an implicit GOAL. Pointing all this out isn't "classism," not by a long shot. But I certainly understand how it might worry those who have been making out like banditos FOR DECADES from this campaign of stealth guerrilla economic warfare. ------------------------ (*) Incidentally, social/economic class isn't a "suspect/protected" category for equal protection purposes. Race/ethnicity IS, almost definitionally. So in a very real sense your rhetorical statement is correct.

Topic.Title: not all baggers are racist

Message.Msg: IF your OVERALL federal tax rate WAS actually 30% last year (and not just at the margin, on the last dollar taxed), then I say BULLY! God is in her Heaven and all is right with the World. Though personally I'd like to see a certified copy of your actual return before I cede the point. "Trust but verify," right? And IF you grossed a million last year, then you have PROFITED ECONOMICALLY from being a U.S. citizen (or from being allowed to reside and/or do business here) many times more than someone grossing $20k. Exactly how much is difficult to say, entangled as this assessment is with diminishing marginal utility, the level of income required for minimum subsistence/survival, etc. But many, MANY times more. But the actual, real-world economic impact to you of forking over your $200k (= 20% of $1M) is in fact FAR LESS than the actual, real-world economic impact of that guy forking over his $4k (= 20% of $20k). You may have to put off your Aspen vacation ski chalet purchase for one more year, and be forced to make do with the Park City condo instead. He and his family may have no food or shelter (let alone medical care) for a substantial part of the same year. And in fact, the rich also DO take advantage of and benefit from publicly provided services (police, fire, land/sea/air routes, military, THE COURT SYSTEM, etc., etc.) at a MUCH higher rate than Mr. Middle Class, either directly or indirectly (as when their investments benefit from public infrastructure, land invasions and occupations of oil-rich nations, etc.). There: I have just provided you with an overview of several ECONOMICALLY SOUND reasons why taxes should virtually(?) always be PROGRESSIVE, and virtually(?) never REGRESSIVE. No need to thank me. Happy to straighten out your thinking on this, as on many other issues.

Message.Title: Ron Paul people Hijacked Nevadas votes, Ron won't endorse Romney
Message.Msg: During the GOP debates, Mitt and Ron got along, many saw them not attacking eachother as a back room deal. Others thought Romney didn't want to make enemies with Paul in case he needed the Pauliac votes if conservatives stayed home disappointed Rick, or Newt was not chosen. Well everyone was wrong. Paul won't endorse Romney even though his son Rand is speaking today at the convention, and Ron is being treated respectfully. Worse, on the first ballot Nevada's delegation voted for Paul even though Mitt won the votes. Seems that the chair of the state was a Paul person, and the law says they are bound to vote for the winner on the first ballot has been ignored in favor of Paul. The Nevada voters for everyone other than Paul had their vote disenfranchised by this despicable action. Personally I would like each of these Sons of Beeches sued civilly and be fined lots of money.

Topic.Title: WHY DOES EVERYONE LIKE RYAN AND ROMNEY SO VERY VERY MUCH? IS IT

Message.Msg: I was talking to a lot of people today, many life long Democrats, and everyone said Ann Romney was a Class Act. I don't think Ann will be taking any $500,000 Spanish vacations with scores of friends at the Taxpayers expense. I don't think Ann will have a huge staff , travel separately from Mitt when they are both going to the same place taking different jumbo jets. I don't think Ann will take dozens of vacation costing the taxpayer $10 million dollars a year. I think Ann has class, like Barbra and Laura Bush had, and style like Jackie Kennedy had. I caught Ann's speech on TV last night and she is a person in touch with how fragile life can be, one moment your healthy the next you have horrible illness like she had. Ann raised kids, 5 boys, she wasn't rich back then Romney gave away his inherited wealth. Ann got both Breast Cancer and MS at times during her life. Its going to be a mature Lady that will be our First Lady. A wise woman who is a Lady in more than the Title. I like her more than Mitt, but she helped me appreciate Mitt more last night than listening to Mitt during Two Presidential campaign has. I got the sense that Mitt was a good husband and father, helped his friends without taking credit for the help or asking anything in return. Unlike Obama who make $72,000 per month in book royalties and won't help his Brother who lives in a straw hut in Kenya or his illegal Aunt on welfare in Boston. Obama only want to help others if the government pays for it. He is not a person who is good to friends and family. Ask Oprah. Yes, Ann will be a good person to make forgetting the Wookie easy.
